column4: hi i got Vbox 2.0 when i try to update i get a message "Conflicts with Installed package Vbox-2.1" how should i resolve this conflict
i dont want to lost out on winxp which i am running in vbox

I have VBox2.1 now i got an update message so i downloaded Vbox3.0 and when i try to run that .deb package I get a conflicting error.. i would delete my vbox but then i may lose out on my prior OSes i am running on my Vbox
is the version your currently running direct from vbox or from the repos?

go to their latest which I think is 3.5..  if you feel hesitant copy the current vm's to a different directory as a backup.. but I've never had an issue upgrading vbox.. it doesn't touch your vm's.. just the main program
I am running Ubuntu 8.04LTS and it does not have Vbox.. in its repos.. (ie. synaptic package manager)
3.0.1 vs <whatever> is what I'm running on my 8.04 install.. I upgrade with each release.. no issues.
its vbox 3.0.10 I go to help->check for updates
it complains that the other is installed.. it will remove it and install the latest
I downloaded the .deb package.. now when i open it it gets oped says conflicts but does not give me an Install option.. its greyed out
that's really strange.. is the older vbox open or the vm running?
no.. just the program itself.. not your vms
i deleted the old on .. took backup.. now i am installing the package.. should i keep the old kernal files back
